rejectionDialog.speaker: valentin
rejectionDialog.text: No, no, NO! This is unacceptable! You have made too many mistakes. Your evidence is weak, your logic is flawed. I cannot accept this accusation. Please... investigate more thoroughly before you accuse someone again!

emma.motive: She believed she could improve the recipe
emma.confession: I... I couldn't help myself! When I saw the erdbeerstrudel sitting there, I knew Valentin had potential, but his recipe... it needed refinement. I tasted it and realized I could make it perfect. So I... I took it to study the technique. I never meant to eat the whole thing!

statements.text: I was reading in the corner the whole time!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: But this hiding spot shows you could have slipped away unnoticed behind the bookshelf...
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't contradict Emma's statement.

statements.text: I never even went near Valentin's table!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: These papers show you had strong opinions about the recipe... and were close enough to take it!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't prove Emma went to the table.
statements.bonusResponse: Not only do these papers prove your obsession, but these crumbs found near the table clinch it! You were definitely there!

statements.text: Why would I ever take someone else's dessert?
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Because you wanted to 'improve' it! These notes prove your obsession with perfecting baked goods!
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't establish a motive.
statements.bonusResponse: Your notes show the motive, and this napkin with strawberry stains shows you acted on it! You couldn't resist analyzing his technique!

klaus.motive: He was hungry and couldn't resist
klaus.confession: I... I was just so hungry! I had been reading for hours and skipped lunch. When I smelled that delicious erdbeerstrudel, I couldn't help myself. I'm so sorry, Valentin!

statements.text: I was at my desk reading the entire afternoon. I never left my seat!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: But this hiding spot behind the bookshelf... you could have slipped away without being noticed!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't prove Klaus left his desk.

statements.text: Why would I even want to eat someone else's dessert? I wasn't even hungry!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Then explain this empty plate found near your area! Looks like someone was very hungry...
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't establish Klaus's hunger as a motive.

statements.text: Even if I was hungry, you have no proof I took the strudel!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: These pastry crumbs tell a different story! Strawberry and vanilla... just like Valentin's erdbeerstrudel!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't directly link Klaus to the missing strudel.

luca.motive: He wanted to taste it out of curiosity
luca.confession: I admit it! I saw the erdbeerstrudel and my curiosity got the better of me. I just wanted one small taste to understand Valentin's technique... but it was so good I couldn't stop!

statements.text: I was too busy organizing the shelves to notice any desserts!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Organizing near this hidden gap? That gave you the perfect opportunity to slip away unnoticed!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't connect Luca to the strudel.

statements.text: I would never take someone's food without asking! That's completely against my nature!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Then why was this napkin with strawberry jam traces found in your area? Your 'curiosity' got the better of you!

statements.text: Even if I was curious, you have no proof I actually took it!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: This suspiciously clean plate tells another story. Someone carefully cleaned up... trying to hide the evidence!
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't prove Luca took the strudel.

marianne.motive: She was jealous of Valentin's baking skills
marianne.confession: Fine! I took it! Valentin is always showing off his baking skills, making everyone praise him. I wanted to see if it was really that good... and maybe make sure no one else got to taste his 'masterpiece'!

statements.text: I don't care about baking! It's a waste of time!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: These crossed-out recipe notes tell a different story... You care a lot about baking, enough to critique Valentin's work!
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't connect to Marianne's feelings about baking.

statements.text: Even if I did care, I don't even like sweets! Why would I take a strudel?
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: These strawberry-scented crumbs suggest otherwise! You couldn't resist seeing if his dessert was really that good!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't prove Marianne likes sweets.

statements.text: You still can't prove I had the opportunity to take it!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: This hidden gap behind the bookshelf gave you the perfect cover to strike without being seen!

sebastian.motive: He thought it would be funny
sebastian.confession: Okay, okay! I took it! I thought it would be a hilarious prank. Valentin is always so serious about his baking. I was going to give it back... after I had a taste. But it was too delicious, and I ate the whole thing!

statements.text: I was far too busy with my studies to notice any desserts! Ask anyone!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Your 'busy studies' left time for this empty plate though! Looks like someone took a snack break!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't contradict Sebastian's statement about being busy.

statements.text: I would never pull a prank like that! I'm far too mature for such childish behavior!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: This carelessly discarded napkin suggests you weren't so careful after your 'prank'!
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't establish Sebastian's character.

statements.text: You have no proof connecting me to the actual theft!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: These pastry crumbs paint a clear picture! The strawberry scent is unmistakable - Valentin's erdbeerstrudel!
statements.incorrectResponse: That doesn't directly connect Sebastian to the theft.

valentin.motive: This makes no sense - he made the strudel!
valentin.confession: Wait, why would I eat my own erdbeerstrudel that I was saving? This doesn't make any sense! Are you sure you've thought this through?

statements.text: But... I made that strudel to share with everyone! Why would I hide and eat my own creation?
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Well... these crumbs... I suppose... Actually, this doesn't make much sense...
statements.incorrectResponse: That evidence doesn't support this accusation.

statements.text: I was the one who reported it missing! This accusation is completely illogical!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: Perhaps... wait, no. You're right. This doesn't add up at all.

statements.text: I think you need to reconsider your evidence. This makes absolutely no sense!
statements.speaker: suspect
statements.correctResponse: You know what... you're absolutely right. I need to think this through more carefully.
statements.incorrectResponse: This line of reasoning is clearly incorrect.

valentinReaction.emma: Emma?! But you always gave such thoughtful feedback on my baking! I never thought your perfectionism would lead to... this.
valentinReaction.klaus: Klaus! I should have known you'd be eyeing my desserts. Your appetite is legendary!
valentinReaction.luca: Luca, your curiosity finally got the better of you! I suppose I should be flattered it was that irresistible.
valentinReaction.marianne: Marianne... I had no idea you felt that competitive about baking. We could have collaborated instead!
valentinReaction.sebastian: Sebastian! A prank? Really? Well, I suppose I can appreciate the humor... once I calm down.
valentinReaction.valentin: Wait, this doesn't make any sense. I think there's been a mistake in the investigation...

victory.bonusAcknowledgment: Impressive detective work! You found every clue in the library and solved the mystery with perfect evidence.

badEnding.despairSpeech: I... I give up. After two false accusations, I can't trust anyone anymore. Everyone, you may leave. I'll just have to live with never knowing who ate my precious erdbeerstrudel...
badEnding.failureExplanation: You made too many incorrect accusations. Valentin has lost faith in your detective abilities, and the mystery remains unsolved. The culprit walks free, leaving Valentin heartbroken and dessertless.
